reviews.sentence: Linda and the rest of the staff were very accommodating to our needs. Our first room was a little too warm. The AC unit was not cooling correctly. They switched our room with no hassle.

No refrigerator or microwave in executive suite. We arrived on a sunday afternoon and checked in about 330 pm. My wife had made reservations on hotelcom for two nights and we chose to stay in the executive queen suite. At arrival at the hotel the staff was very helpful and polite and offered to have someone help us with our luggage. We had a room in the seventh floor because it was there where the executives suites were located. As we entered our room the bathroom were kind of small but clean. The room was spacious and the beds were comfortable. The only thing missing in this executive queen suite was a refrigerator and a microwave. My wife and I have two kids who like to have snacks and drinks to keep chilled but there was no refrigerator or microwave in the room. We had to work with what we had.
That some of the rooms did not come with at least a free continental breakfast.

Disappointed. I stayed in a pet friendly room on a different floor with my dog though I paid for the Executive floor with a breakfast included. I was told that pets could not stay on the Executive floor after I had checked in. When I arrived in the room the bathroom was dirty in a disgusting way a housekeeper did come and clean it up. The room itself was shabby with faded furniture and old fraying carpet. Twice I had to call for a person to fix the WIFI so I could even use my computer. Also I ordered room service breakfasts thinking these would be the breakfast which was included in my room rate. This was not the case. To get my free breakfast I had to go to the hotel restaurant and leave my dog alone in the room which was against their written rules. One morning I gave up trying to get the tv on since the remote was not working. Over the years I have stayed at Hilton Doubletree hotels and found the same worn out conditions in the rooms. The one thing that was exceptional was the friendliness professionalism and helpfulness of the employees. With the exception of one person I found them to be the best thing about this hotel.

STAY AWAY. Came to visit our son. He is here in med school. Just happened to also be the Family weekend for U or A. Spent 230 per night with expectation of the expected accommodations of a resort Hilton. it is obvious that this is Holowen month because this place is in costume. this is maybe an OK Motel 6. Dark drab outdated decor. We stayed on the executive floor. Evening social was microwave tacos and square cheze out of a bag. The fridge in our room looked like my fridge that I used in college dented and dirty. What a farse. Never NEVER STAY HERE AT ANY PRICEManager said that this hotel was renovated 6 years ago. I find that hard to believe. Comparing this to other Hilton properties here in Tucson expecialy the El Conquisatodor that true resort had rooms for less then this pathetic excuse of a hotel. I wanted to see if the rate was consistant for this hotel. The last weekend of October the same room here at the Hilton East goes for 85 dollars. What a rip off.

Room 34 TV. TV was stuck on one Spanish Channel only. Called front desk to have one fix. Several hours later no one had fixed. On my way out I stopped at front desk. Maintenance guy was there talking to front desk woman. waited till they were done. He heard me tell the front desk about my tv and said I was next to be fixed. Told him I was on my way out now. Then during my conversation with the front desk woman she picked up the phone and handled a complaint from any client in another room at your hotel. It took me 20 minutes at the front desk to handle this simple request regarding the tv.

Okay but not near anything. Hotel is at the end of everything downtown which makes it quiet but a long way from anything else. It was weird hearing the coyote symphony outside my window at night as well. On the plus side the hotel is quite the people are nice and friendly and it is clean. On the downside the air conditioning units are so loud that even when I turned mine off I could here the one in the room next to my so loud that it sounded like it was in my room. Also the doors have auto closers on them that are very loud when the shut I could here the doors at the other end of the hall closing all night. I have stayed in this hotel twice and got such a poor sleep both times and it is in the middle of nothing that I probably will not do it again. Which is to bad because the people really were very nice.
Nice view form our room. The A C did not work. the room smelled bad. big old hotel not too bad for the price though.

Very nice hotel have stayed here often. I I ’m very happy with my experience. Do I think I would have changed and this is experience fault is that the room charge me 50 more to my credit card for incidentals that they say will be reversed in 7 to 10 days but I was n’t expecting that.
Pleasant. Fire alarm went off multiple times no breakfast when requested TV did not work.

Great Place to Stay. The staff is very professional friendly and courteous. We were in town to visit our son and chose the location close to him. We were very satisfied with the staff room and location. Would stay there again.
We met in a private Room at their restaurant upstairs and food was delicious.

Excellent hotel bargain priced. Very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel and the superb customer service. Seems that the hotel was recently renovated open and modern concept boasting beautiful views of the desert mountains.
Great experience very small gym. Clean rooms and entertainment.
Fantastic hotel with a modern look and freshly updated rooms. There is a restaurant on site and the for is good. There are also several places within a 05 mile walk.
Very clean and elegant. Soft clean carpet and deliciously luxurious bed in the perfectly inviting comfortable rooms.

Clean comfortable and welcoming stay. The room was nice clean and comfortable. Hotel ambiance was great. The restaurant has really good food and drink options. The house wine is amazing. Overall staff was extremely friendly and my stay was hospitable.

The photos do not do this hotel justice. It is gorgeous and meticulously clean. Staff are friendly and respectful. Room spotless and updated. Pool area spotless. I was especially impressed by the bartender making a huge effort for me to make a drink he had probably not made in a long time going to the kitchen to get coffee and even another trip to add whipped cream for a Spanish coffee. Without me asking he even put it in a pool safe cup. Views from the room and pool were stunning. Just loved it there. One thing I did not like. I had asked for a room with a view that was quiet and we were put smack dab next to a service elevator that ran day and night a lot of loud banging. But even then I was surprised how quiet it was in general.
I had a meeting there. The room was clean and the food was good.

My daughter moved to Tucson and this hotel was close by less than a mile. The service was great the rooms were immaculate and the staff was outstanding. I will certainly be staying here again when o come to visit her.
